quotes.sentence: He doth nothing but talk of his horse.

quotes.sentence: All the world's a stage, And all the men and women merely players.

quotes.sentence: A man can die but once.

quotes.sentence: To whom God will, there be the victory.

quotes.sentence: Lord, what fools these mortals be!

quotes.sentence: Wars begin when you will, but they do not end when you please.

quotes.sentence: He who defends everything defends nothing.

quotes.sentence: They say that kings are made in the image of God. If that is what he looks like, I feel sorry for God.

quotes.sentence: If soldiers were to begin to think, not one of them would remain in the army.

quotes.sentence: I am the King of Rome, and above grammar.

quotes.sentence: When you see contention amongst your enemies, go and sit at ease with your friends; but when you see them of one mind, string your bow, and place stones upon the ramparts.

quotes.sentence: Inflict not on an enemy every injury in your power, for he may afterwards become your friend.

quotes.sentence: I have loved justice and hated inequity; and therefore I die in exile.

quotes.sentence: It is easy to be brave behind a castle wall.

quotes.sentence: To carry on war, three things are necessary: money, money, and yet more money.

quotes.sentence: I speak Spanish to God, Italian to women, French to men, and German to my horse.

quotes.sentence: Had I been present at the creation, I would have given some useful hints for the better ordering of the universe.

quotes.sentence: O Liberty! What crimes are committed in thy name!

quotes.sentence: Put your shoulder to the wheel.

quotes.sentence: Trust not too much to appearances.

quotes.sentence: I fear the Greeks, even when they bring gifts.

quotes.sentence: Death twitches my ear. Live, he says, I am coming.

quotes.sentence: Fortune sides with him who dares.

quotes.sentence: Do not throw the arrow which will return against you.

quotes.sentence: A god from the machine.

quotes.sentence: Art for art's sake is an empty phrase. Art for the sake of truth, art for the sake of the good and the beautiful, that is the faith I am searching for.

quotes.sentence: To name a thing is easy: the difficulty is to discern it before its appearance.

quotes.sentence: The whole is more than the sum of its parts.

quotes.sentence: Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.

quotes.sentence: It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried.

quotes.sentence: Logic: The art of thinking and reasoning in strict accordance with the limitations and incapacities of the human misunderstanding.

quotes.sentence: I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy.

quotes.sentence: For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return.

quotes.sentence: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.

quotes.sentence: A good teacher is like a candle – it consumes itself to light the way for others.

quotes.sentence: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.

quotes.sentence: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

quotes.sentence: Society often forgives the criminal; it never forgives the dreamer.

quotes.sentence: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.

quotes.sentence: There are many wild beasts on land and in the sea, but the beastliest of all is woman.

quotes.sentence: The workman still is greater than his work.

quotes.sentence: It will not always be summer: build barns.

quotes.sentence: Judge a tree from its fruit, not from its leaves.

quotes.sentence: This is slavery, not to speak one's thought.

quotes.sentence: Cleverness is not wisdom.

quotes.sentence: What you have to do, you do with play. The universe is God’s play.

quotes.sentence: People forget facts, but they remember stories.

quotes.sentence: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.

quotes.sentence: Write your Sad times in Sand, Write your Good times in Stone.

quotes.sentence: Tradition will accustom people to any atrocity
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.sentence: Woe to me, my mother, that you have borne me As a man of strife and a man of contention to all the land! I have not lent, nor have men lent money to me, Yet everyone curses me.

quotes.sentence: War does not determine who is right - only who is left.

quotes.sentence: Woe to the defeated!

quotes.sentence: Your library is your paradise.

quotes.sentence: Idlers do not make history: they suffer it!

quotes.sentence: Fear is the cheapest room in the house. I would like to see you living in better conditions.

quotes.sentence: Strike, if you will, but listen.

quotes.sentence: If someone asks, ‘But what in the end is a philosopher?’ I would say ‘A philosopher is a human being who fights in theory.

quotes.sentence: There is nothing more foolish than a foolish laugh.

quotes.sentence: Mankind must put an end to war, or war will put an end to mankind.

quotes.sentence: Never forget that your weapon was made by the lowest bidder.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.sentence: Whether you like it or not, history is on our side. We will bury you!
quotes.author: Nikita Khrushchev

quotes.sentence: Politicians are the same all over. They promise to build bridges even when there are no rivers.
quotes.author: Nikita Khrushchev

quotes.sentence: I once said, 'We will bury you,' and I got into trouble with it. Of course we will not bury you with a shovel. Your own working class will bury you.
quotes.author: Nikita Khrushchev

quotes.sentence: Nothing is easier than self-deceit.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.sentence: Of all our possessions, wisdom alone is imortal.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.sentence: Right is not unlimited, but is limited by the laws.
quotes.author: Aeschines

quotes.sentence: No battle plan ever survives contact with the enemy.
quotes.author: Helmuth von Moltke the Elder

quotes.sentence: Plans are worthless, but planning is everything.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.sentence: History does not long entrust the care of freedom to the weak or timid.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.sentence: You don't lead by hitting people over the head - that's assault, not leadership.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.sentence: I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.
quotes.author: Robert E. Lee

quotes.sentence: The world needs leaders of vision instead of leaders on television.
quotes.author: Lech Walesa

quotes.sentence: I'm lazy. But it's the lazy people who invented the wheel and the bicycle because they didn't like walking or carrying things.
quotes.author: Lech Walesa

quotes.sentence: I must tell you that the supply of words on the world market is plentiful, but the demand is falling.
quotes.author: Lech Walesa

quotes.sentence: Historians are like deaf people who go on answering questions that no one has asked them.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.sentence: The causes of events are ever more interesting than the events themselves.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.sentence: God cannot alter the past, though historians can.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.sentence: I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. I shall wear no crowns and win no glory. I shall live and die at my post. I am the sword in the darkness. I am the watcher on the walls.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin, The oath of Night's Watch

quotes.sentence: He who is virtuous is wise; and he who is wise is good; and he who is good is happy.
quotes.author: Boethius

quotes.sentence: “Nothing is miserable unless you think it so.
quotes.author: Boethius

quotes.sentence: At the heart of capitalism is creative destruction.
quotes.author: Joseph A. Schumpeter

quotes.sentence: The ballot is stronger than bullets.
quotes.author: Joseph A. Schumpeter

quotes.sentence: Politicians like to tell people what they want to hear - and what they want to hear is what won't happen.
quotes.author: Paul Samuelson

quotes.sentence: Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book.
quotes.author: Stéphane Mallarmé

quotes.sentence: The flesh is sad, alas, and I have read all the books.
quotes.author: Stéphane Mallarmé

quotes.sentence: Poetry is the language of a state of crisis.
quotes.author: Stéphane Mallarmé

quotes.sentence: If you want money more than anything, you'll be bought and sold.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.sentence: Clean out your ears, don't listen for what you already know.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.sentence: Life is balance of holding on and letting go.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.sentence: If you are looking for a friend who is faultless, you will be friendless.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.sentence: The Earth would die if the sun stopped kissing her.
quotes.author: Hafez

quotes.sentence: All teems with symbol; the wise man is the man who in any one thing can read another.
quotes.author: Protinus

quotes.sentence: First gain the victory and then make the best use of it you can.
quotes.author: Horatio Nelson

quotes.sentence: Before this time to-morrow I shall have gained a peerage, or Westminster Abbey.
quotes.author: Horatio Nelson

quotes.sentence: Victory or Westminster Abbey.
quotes.author: Horatio Nelson

quotes.sentence: Time is everything; five minutes make the difference between victory and defeat
quotes.author: Horatio Nelson

quotes.sentence: Something must be left to chance; nothing is sure in a sea fight above all.
quotes.author: Horatio Nelson

quotes.sentence: God save me from my friends. I can protect myself from my enemies.
quotes.author: Claude Louis Hector de Villars

quotes.sentence: A game is a series of meaningful choices.
quotes.author: Sid Meier

quotes.sentence: Civilizations die from suicide, not by murder.
quotes.author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quotes.sentence: Books are the carriers of civilization. Without books, history is silent.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.sentence: Six hours' sleep for a man, seven for a woman, and eight for a fool.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.sentence: God is on the side with the best artillery
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.sentence: If I were to give liberty to the press, my power could not last three days.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.sentence: Fish die when they are out of water, and people die without law and order.
quotes.author: The Talmud

quotes.sentence: Live well. It is the greatest revenge.
quotes.author: The Talmud

quotes.sentence: Whoever stands by a just cause cannot possibly be called a terrorist.
quotes.author: Yasser Arafat

quotes.sentence: One's work may be finished someday, but one's education never.
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.sentence: The difference between treason and patriotism is only a matter of dates.
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.sentence: Great is truth. Fire cannot burn it nor water drown it.
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.sentence: Woman was God's second mistake.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: There are no facts, only interpretations.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Everything the State says is a lie, and everything it has it has stolen.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Fear is the mother of morality.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: The lie is a condition of life.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: To make the individual uncomfortable, that is my task.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Nobody is more inferior than those who insist on being equal.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Everything matters. Nothing's important.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: We have art so that we shall not die of reality.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: The world is beautiful, but has a disease called man.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: There's no defense against stupidity.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: The real question is: How much truth can I stand?
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: It is my ambition to say in ten sentences what others say in a whole book.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Thoughts are the shadows of our feelings - always darker, emptier and simpler.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Fear is the mother of morality.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Poets are shameless with their experiences: they exploit them.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.sentence: Let us leave the beautiful women to men with no imagination.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.sentence: O wise man, wash your hands of that friend who associates with your enemies.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: A little beauty is preferable to much wealth.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: Virtue is in the mind, not in the appearance.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: He who is a slave to his stomach seldom worships God.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: Ants, fighting together, will vanquish the lion.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: Be not in the desire of thine own ease.
quotes.author: Saadi Shirazi

quotes.sentence: No one conquers who doesn't fight.
quotes.author: Gabriel Biel

quotes.sentence: I am the King of Rome, and above grammar.
quotes.author: Sigismund, Holy Roman Emperor

quotes.sentence: All religions are equally sublime to the ignorant, useful to the politician, and ridiculous to the philosopher.
quotes.author: Titus Lucretius Carus

quotes.sentence: Fear was the first thing on Earth to create gods.
quotes.author: Titus Lucretius Carus

quotes.sentence: How many evils have flowed from religion.
quotes.author: Titus Lucretius Carus

quotes.sentence: My destination is no longer a place, rather a new way of seeing.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.sentence: Instead of seeking new landscapes, develop new eyes.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.sentence: We think and name in one world, we live and feel in another.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.sentence: Even though our lives wander, our memories remain in one place.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.sentence: The creation of the world did not occur at the beginning of time, it occurs every day.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.sentence: I usually solve problems by letting them devour me.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.sentence: He is terribly afraid of dying because he hasn’t yet lived.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.sentence: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.sentence: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.sentence: When I quote others I do so in order to express my own ideas more clearly.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.sentence: I will govern according to the common weal, but not according to the common will.
quotes.author: James I of England

quotes.sentence: Smoking is hateful to the nose, harmful to the brain, and dangerous to the lungs.
quotes.author: James I of England

quotes.sentence: Were I not a king, I would be a university man.
quotes.author: James I of England

quotes.sentence: The more numerous the laws, the more corrupt the government.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.sentence: The worst crimes were dared by a few, willed by more and tolerated by all.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.sentence: The Romans brought devestation, but they called it peace.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.sentence: I am my nearest neighbour.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.sentence: The only thing we have power over in the universe is our own thoughts.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.sentence: Whenever anyone has offended me, I try to raise my soul so high that the offense cannot reach it.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.sentence: Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.sentence: There are always four sides to a story: your side, their side, the truth and what really happened.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.sentence: Freedom is the power to choose our own chains
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.sentence: I would rather be a man of paradoxes than a man of prejudices.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.sentence: Those people who treat politics and morality separately will never understand either of them.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.sentence: I may be no better, but at least I am different.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.sentence: All things must be examined, debated, investigated without exception and without regard for anyone's feelings.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.sentence: Doctors are always working to preserve our health and cooks to destroy it, but the latter are the more often successful.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.sentence: Give, but, if possible, spare the poor man the shame of begging.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.sentence: What is a monster? A being whose survival is incompatible with the existing order.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.sentence: An imbalance between rich and poor is the oldest and most fatal ailment of all republics.
quotes.author: Pultarch

quotes.sentence: It was not important how many enemies there are, but where the enemy is.
quotes.author: Pultarch

quotes.sentence: No man ever wetted clay and then left it, as if there would be bricks by chance and fortune.
quotes.author: Pultarch

quotes.sentence: Be kind. Every person you meet is fighting a difficult battle.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.sentence: True friendship can exist only between equals.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.sentence: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.sentence: Better to complete a small task well, than to do much imperfectly.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.sentence: For this feeling of wonder shows that you are a philosopher, since wonder is the only beginning of philosophy.
quotes.author: Plato, Theaetetus

quotes.sentence: Poverty is the lack of many things, but avarice is the lack of all things.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.sentence: Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.sentence: Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.sentence: Our supreme governors, the mob.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.sentence: The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.sentence: Foolish writers and readers are created for each other.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.sentence: Read anything but history,.. for history must be false.
quotes.author: Robert Walpole

quotes.sentence: Whatever was the conduct of England, I am equally arraigned.
quotes.author: Robert Walpole

quotes.sentence: If I were an American, as I am an Englishman, while a foreign troop was landed in my country, I never would lay down my arms never never never!
quotes.author: William Pitt

quotes.sentence: Confidence is a plant of slow growth in an aged bosom.' , 'William Pitt
Don't talk to me about a man's being able to talk sense; everyone can talk sense. Can he talk nonsense?
quotes.author: William Pitt

quotes.sentence: We will not have failure - only success and new learning.
quotes.author: Queen Victoria of England

quotes.sentence: The important thing is not what they think of me, but what I think of them.
quotes.author: Queen Victoria of England

quotes.sentence: Give my people plenty of beer, good beer, and cheap beer, and you will have no revolution among them.
quotes.author: Queen Victoria of England

quotes.sentence: We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat. They do not exist.
quotes.author: Queen Victoria of England

quotes.sentence: Beware of artists, they mix with all classes of society and are therefore most dangerous.
quotes.author: Queen Victoria of England

quotes.sentence: Bring me a cup of tea and the 'Times.'
quotes.author: Queen Victoria of England

quotes.sentence: Work hard, trust in God, and keep your bowels open
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.sentence: Keep your faith in God, but keep your powder dry.
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.sentence: Necessity has no law.
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.sentence: There isn't a tree to hang a man, water to drown a man nor soil to bury a man
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.sentence: A man-of-war is the best ambassador.
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.sentence: Our swords are in God's hands, And our faith is in the Lord. Charge!
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.sentence: Alas! I have civilized my own subjects; I have conquered other nations; yet I have not been able to civilize or to conquer myself.
quotes.author: Peter the Great

quotes.sentence: Every bullet has its billet.
quotes.author: William III of England

quotes.sentence: What worries you, masters you.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.sentence: Who lies for you will lie against you.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.sentence: New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not already common.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.sentence: Where there is no law there is no freedom.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.sentence: The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.sentence: In view of the fact that God limited the intelligence of man, it seems unfair that He did not also limit his stupidity.
quotes.author: Konrad Adenauer

quotes.sentence: When everybody else thinks it's the end, we have to begin.
quotes.author: Konrad Adenauer

quotes.sentence: History is the sum total of things that could have been avoided.
quotes.author: Konrad Adenauer

quotes.sentence: God designed the stomach to eject what is bad for it, but not the human brain.
quotes.author: Konrad Adenauer

quotes.sentence: We were united not only by political respect for each other, but also by deep mutual sympathy as people.
quotes.author: Helmut Kohl

quotes.sentence: How can anyone govern a nation that has two hundred and forty-six different kinds of cheese?
quotes.author: Charles de Gaulle

quotes.sentence: Belgium is a country invented by the British to annoy the French.

quotes.sentence: I have come to the conclusion that politics are too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.
quotes.author: Charles de Gaulle

quotes.sentence: The problem is that the East is producing missiles and the West is producing pacifists.
quotes.author: Francois Mitterrand

quotes.sentence: A man loses contact with reality if he is not surrounded by his books.
quotes.author: Francois Mitterrand

quotes.sentence: Even bad books are books and therefore sacred.
quotes.author: Gunter Grass

quotes.sentence: I expected more from literature than from real, naked life.
quotes.author: Gunter Grass

quotes.sentence: Give me just one generation of youth, and I'll transform the whole world.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.sentence: Three keys to success: read, read, read.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.sentence: The only one who doesn't make mistakes is the one who doesn't do anything.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.sentence: When it comes to hang the capitalists they will compete with each other to sell us the rope at a lower price
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.sentence: Trust is good, but control is better.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.sentence: Sweat saves blood, blood saves lives, but brains saves both.
quotes.author: Erwin Rommel

quotes.sentence: Training errors are recorded on paper. Tactical errors are etched in stone.
quotes.author: Erwin Rommel

quotes.sentence: Everyone has a right to be stupid, but Comrade MacDonald abuses the privilege.
quotes.author: Leon Trotsky

quotes.sentence: He who has two languages has two souls.
quotes.author: Quintus Ennius

quotes.sentence: My imagination is a monastery and I am its monk.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.sentence: A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.
quotes.author: from "Salt from My Attic", by John Augustus Shedd

quotes.sentence: Never be afraid to try something new. Remember, amateurs built the ark. Professionals built the Titanic.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.sentence: Recession is when a neighbor loses his job. Depression is when you lose yours.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.sentence: Those who look for seashells will find seashells; those who open them will find pearls.
quotes.author: Al-Ghazali

quotes.sentence: Does money upset the hearts of learned men? He answered, "men whose hearts are changed by money are not learned".
